abstract: West Virginia ban on abortions 20 weeks after conception goes into effect after Republican-controlled Legislature overrides Gov Earl Ray Tomblin's two vetoes of the ban.
lead_paragraph: A ban on abortions 20 weeks after conception went into effect Tuesday, more than two months after the Republican-controlled Legislature overrode a veto by Gov. Earl Ray Tomblin.

headline.main: West Virginia: Abortion Restriction Goes Into Effect
headline.print_headline: West Virginia: Abortion Restriction Goes Into Effect

snippet: A ban on abortions 20 weeks after conception went into effect Tuesday, more than two months after the Republican-controlled Legislature overrode a veto by Gov. Earl Ray Tomblin.
